title: Army, Police rescue 180 stranded undergrads in Hantana
author: Author not found
Content: A collective effort by the Army and Police enabled the successful rescue of students, from the Ragama Medical Faculty, who were stranded in the Hantana mountain range due to inclement weather.  The operation lasting over six hours ensured the safe rescue of 180 students who had climbed the Hantana mountains on Saturday (3) afternoon. Group of 60 men and 120 women students reportedly lost their way back due to dense fog prevalent at the time. The undergraduates were eventually found after a joint operation initiated by Police in response to information given. Following the incident, Police advised the public not to go hiking in Hantana if one was not familiar with the weather beforehand. BY K.L. Suraweera – Kandy

title: Warden of Children’s Home in Kalmunai apprehended
author: Author not found
Content: A 28-year-old warden of a children’s home in Kalmunai was apprehended following the death of a 17-year-old boy under her care. Contrary to earlier reports suggesting the boy’s death resulted from an illness during detention, forensic examinations have revealed evidence of an assault leading to his death due to internal bleeding.  The boy passed away on 29 November. The teenager was initially arrested for theft and produced before the Batticaloa Magistrate. Following Court directives, he was kept in the custody of the Department of Probation and Child Care Services at a designated children’s home.  In response to forensic findings, the Kalmunai Police have taken the 28-year-old warden into custody in connection with the incident. The deceased hailed from Kokkadicholai, Batticaloa. BY Keerthi Mendis

title: ‘Ata Pass’–USAID supported Youth Education and Career Outreach Campaign wins top honours
author: Author not found
Content: The United States Agency for International Development’s (USAID) YouLead project sponsored an innovative social media drama series, focusing on career guidance and skills development for Sri Lankan youth, which secured top awards in the Sri Lanka division of a global marketing effectiveness competition. Effie Sri Lanka, a branch of Effie Worldwide, recognised the 10-part series ‘Ata Pass,’ presented on Facebook, YouTube, and TikTok social media platforms in October 2022, at a ceremony held on  28 November in Colombo. The series featured Sri Lankan actors and received more than 6 million views. A complementary campaign directed youth to call centres set up by YouLead in Sinhala and Tamil generated more than 16,000 leads from youth seeking career testing and one-on-one professional career guidance. ‘Ata Pass’ won a total of four individual awards, including gold in the Data-Driven Marketing category, silver in Non-Profit/Pro-Bono, silver in Social Good Non-Profit and bronze in Youth Marketing.  In addition, YouLead received the night’s top two awards – Most Effective Brand of the Year and Most Effective Marketer of the Year – based on the judges’ overall votes. The drama was also emphasised in a widely-played video game. Eight renowned gaming influencers, each embodying one of the ‘Ata Pas’ characters, collectively garnered over 100,000 views in a single 24-hour streaming period. Additionally, the game version secured finalist positions in two Effie categories. ‘Ata Pass’ was a countermeasure to vexing issues facing Sri Lankan youth. The Census Bureau estimates youth unemployment at 24 per cent. Meanwhile, at least 300,000 youth emigrated abroad for economic reasons in 2023 alone. ‘Ata Pass’ aimed to address misconceptions regarding education and careers. The series encouraged youth, empowering them with the right tools and resources to make informed, proactive choices about their own career paths. “We are delighted that this innovative and creative campaign inspired so many youth to seek proper guidance on potential careers here,” said USAID Mission Director Gabriel Grau. “Many Sri Lankan youth see their opportunities in foreign countries, but ‘Ata Pass’ provided them with the insight and understanding of the possibilities afforded to them by employing their talents in Sri Lanka.” ‘Ata Pass’ was conceptualised by the Audacity advertising firm and the campaign was implemented together with ADA Sri Lanka, K&D Media, and Isobar Sri Lanka. The awards come on the heels of four other awards for digital excellence given earlier in November to the Ata Pass/Grand Theft Auto campaign by the Sri Lanka Institute of Marketing.

title: India stands with people of Sri Lanka
author: Author not found
Content: High Commissioner of India to Sri Lanka, Gopal Baglay undertook a three-day visit to the Northern Province from  29 November to 1 December. He was accompanied by senior diplomats of the High Commission. Attesting to the significance of developing railway infrastructure under the India -Sri Lanka development cooperation partnership for the benefit of the people of Sri Lanka, the delegation undertook a journey by Sri Lankan Railways from Colombo to Medawachchiya in modern coaches supplied under an Indian credit line. The train journey also provided an opportunity to experience the riding comfort offered by the upgraded railway line from Anuradhapura. The upgradation work is undertaken by reputed Indian public sector company IRCON, under an ongoing Indian line of credit for the upgradation of the Maho-Omanthai segment. The delegation visited the Talaimannar and Kankesanthurai passenger facilities on 29 December in pursuance of the ongoing efforts for enhanced connectivity through ferry services between mutually agreed points in India and Sri Lanka. It may be recalled that connectivity is the central theme of the economic partnership vision expounded jointly by Prime Minister of India Shri Narendra Modi and Ranil Wickremesinghe, the President of Sri Lanka during the latter’s visit to India in July 2023. Expeditious resumption of regular ferry services is the focus of attention of the Governments of India and      Sri Lanka, who are working closely together in this regard. The High Commissioner visited three islands off Jaffna, namely Nainativu, Analaitivu and Delft, on 30 December to assess the preparedness for implementing the Hybrid Renewable Energy Systems project. The Government of India has committed to support this project with a grant to address the energy needs of the inhabitants of these islands. Responding to the diverse requirements of various sections of society, the High Commissioner inaugurated a programme to donate 1,000 school bags to students across Mannar District at Murunkan Maha Vidyalayam on 29 December in the presence of State Minister  of Rural Economy, K. Kader Masthan. The HC also launched a special financial assistance scheme for underprivileged students at the University of Jaffna on 1 December. In addition, he distributed dry rations to more than 500 families, in Jaffna and Delft Island. Deep freezers were donated to 15 fishermen cooperatives for the use of fishermen in the Jaffna region. Interacting with representatives of the cooperatives at Passaiyoor, the High Commissioner stressed that India is striving to bring benefits of scientific research and expertise for commercially sustainable development of fisheries in  Sri Lanka, including in the Northern Province so that the benefits can directly reach the fishermen and the common people. At the Indian Peace Keeping Forces memorial in Jaffna, the High Commissioner paid homage on 1 December to the brave sons of India who made the supreme sacrifice in Sri Lanka. This was the High Commissioner’s last of several visits to Jaffna during his assignment to Sri Lanka and underscored India’s abiding commitment to the development and well-being of the people of Sri Lanka, including in the Northern Province, through enhanced development cooperation and expanded economic partnership in accordance with the priorities and the requirements of the people of the region.

title: Postal Dept conducts tech awareness programme
author: Author not found
Content: To raise awareness among the public about the latest technology introduced by the Postal Department for enhanced and prompt services, as well as to instill confidence in the community, an awareness programme and procession took place in Akkaraipattu recently. At a meeting attended by Deputy Provincial Postmaster General Gamini Wimalasooriya and Superintendent of Post Offices K.P.S. Priyantha, it was emphasised that Postmasters and employees must be well-versed in the new technologies and services to better serve the public.  Following the meeting, the staff, led by Deputy Provincial Postmaster General Wimalasooriya, walked through the town, visiting shops, institutions and stalls. They engaged with managers, proprietors and salesmen, explaining the latest technologies introduced by the Postal Department. They also provided detailed information on services such as Post Courier, Postal Money Transfer, SL Post COD, E-Telemail, U Packet Service, AD Mail Service, Philatelic products and more. The team addressed any queries and doubts while distributing informative leaflets to those in vehicles. By M.A.P. Deen – Ampara

title: ‘Red’ warning fornaval and fisher communities – Met Dept
author: Author not found
Content: The Department of Meteorology has issued a ‘Red’ warning, signalling strong winds and rough seas for both naval and fisher communities in the deep and shallow sea regions of the southwest Bay of Bengal. According to the advisory, a Deep Depression over the Southwest Bay of Bengal has intensified into a Cyclonic storm, positioned near latitude 11.4°N and longitude 82.5°E as of 05.30 a.m. on Sunday (3), approximately 325 km northeast of Jaffna. This Cyclonic storm has been named ‘MICHAUNG’ (pronounced as ‘MIGJAUM’). The meteorological forecast anticipates the system’s northwestward movement near the North coast of Sri Lanka, heading towards the North Tamil Nadu coast of India. Subsequently, the storm is expected to progress northwards and make landfall along the South Andhra Pradesh coasts around 5 December, the Meteorological Department added.  In light of these developments, both naval and fisher communities are strongly advised to avoid venturing into the designated sea areas over the next 48 hours.

title: Sri Lankan students awarded Allama Iqbal Scholarships for 2023
author: Author not found
Content: The Pakistan High Commission in Colombo in collaboration with the Higher Education Commission, Pakistan held the Allama Iqbal Scholarship Award distribution for 2023 to deserving Sri Lankan students.  The scholarship is named after Allama Muhammad Iqbal, one of the greatest philosophers of all time. He envisioned the freedom movement and separate land for the people of Pakistan, which contributed towards the establishment of Pakistan in 1947. He has been famously known as the ‘Poet of the East’. The scholarship programme started in 2019. This year, the Government of Pakistan through the Higher Education Commission, is awarding 321 fully funded scholarships in its 5th Batch for 2023 to deserving candidates across the Island. Nearly 357 Sri Lankan students have already benefited and are studying in Pakistan pursuing their academic degrees at graduate, postgraduate and PhD level. The next intake will start in February 2024. High Commissioner of Pakistan, Maj. Gen. (R) Umar Farooq Burki, HI (M), in his opening speech said “Pakistan-Sri Lanka relations were longstanding and said  students who embark on studies in Pakistan are our guests and will be looked after in Pakistan as it has been our traditional trademark. He said, fair selection of students across the Island is ensured from all ethnicities irrespective of religion, gender and creed. Pakistan considers each selected student as our Ambassadors, once they are back in Sri Lanka after successful completion of their studies”.  The High Commissioner also, shed light on Allama Muhammad Iqbal’s contribution as one of the greatest philosophers of all time, after whom the scholarship is named. He further said Allama Iqbal’s poetic verses contain deep wisdom in highlighting the importance of education to become a great. The Allama Iqbal Scholarship Award ceremony was attended by Susil Premajayantha, Minister of Education as Chief Guest.  Some prominent personalities also attended the ceremony including Vidura Wickremanayke, Minister of Buddha Sasana, Religious & Cultural Affairs, Nimal Siripala de Silva, President, Sri Lanka Pakistan Parliamentary Association, Chief of Defence Staff (CDS) General Shavendra Silva as the Guest of Honour, Buddhist Theras, MPs along with several other guests. The Higher Education Commission’s team is led by, Director General Aayesha Ikram. She apprised the audience about the project, it’s scope, selection criteria and other components including the upcoming Educational Expo to be held in Sri Lanka with the help of leading Universities in Pakistan. In his concluding remarks, Maj. Gen. (R) Umar Farooq Burki HI (M) said Pakistan will always stand with Sri Lanka and will continue unconditional support in strengthening bilateral cooperation between the two countries.

title: President presents CJF at COP28
author: Author not found
Content: President Ranil Wickremesinghe presented the Climate Justice Forum (CJF) at COP28 in Dubai, UAE, on Saturday (2), emphasising the crucial need to address climate issues with justice and equity.  Joined by figures such as former Maldives President Mohammed Nasheed, Uganda’s Minister of Health Dr. Aceng Jane Ruth, and UNEP Executive Director Inger Anderson, the President stated that the CJF’s resolution would be formally presented at the United Nations. Highlighting the role of private entities and the disparity in fund allocation, President Wickremesinghe invited other nations to join the initiative. He requested collaboration from organisations such as UNEP, UNDP, and the EU to advance the presented initiatives. Anderson welcomed the CJF, emphasising its potential to unify nations against climate change. Minister of Environment Keheliya Rambukwella advocated for global cooperation, and Minister of Foreign Affairs Ali Sabry integrated the CJF into Sri Lanka’s foreign policy. Ugandan Health Minister Dr. Aceng Jane Ruth welcomed the initiative as a potential trendsetter in the fight against climate change. President Wickremesinghe was joined by Minister of Power and Energy Kanchana Wijesekara, MPs Champika Ranawaka, Madhura Vithanage, Ajith Mannapperuma, and M. Rameshwaren. Senior Adviser Ruwan Wijewardena, Environment Advisor Dr. Ananda Mallawatantri, Treasury Adviser Deshal de Mel, International Affairs Director Dinouk Colombage and Private Secretary Sandra Perera also attended the event.

title: President meets Bill Gates at COP28
author: Author not found
Content: During the COP28 summit in Dubai, President Ranil Wickremesinghe held discussions with billionaire philanthropist and Microsoft co-founder, Bill Gates.  The talks centred on global challenges and Sri Lanka’s potential leadership in the tropical belt, the President’s Media Division (PMD) said. During the meeting, Gates pledged support through the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation, with a specific focus on agricultural modernisation, data systems and climate expertise, the PMD added.  This engagement occurred at Expo City, Dubai.

Pakistan considers each selected student as our Ambassadors, once they are back in Sri Lanka after successful completion of their studies”.  The High Commissioner also, shed light on Allama Muhammad Iqbal’s contribution as one of the greatest philosophers of all time, after whom the scholarship is named. He further said Allama Iqbal’s poetic verses contain deep wisdom in highlighting the importance of education to become a great. The Allama Iqbal Scholarship Award ceremony was attended by Susil Premajayantha, Minister of Education as Chief Guest.  Some prominent personalities also attended the ceremony including Vidura Wickremanayke, Minister of Buddha Sasana, Religious & Cultural Affairs, Nimal Siripala de Silva, President, Sri Lanka Pakistan Parliamentary Association, Chief of Defence Staff (CDS) General Shavendra Silva as the Guest of Honour, Buddhist Theras, MPs along with several other guests. The Higher Education Commission’s team is led by, Director General Aayesha Ikram. She apprised the audience about the project, it’s scope, selection criteria and other components including the upcoming Educational Expo to be held in Sri Lanka with the help of leading Universities in Pakistan. In his concluding remarks, Maj. Gen. (R) Umar Farooq Burki HI (M) said Pakistan will always stand with Sri Lanka and will continue unconditional support in strengthening bilateral cooperation between the two countries.

title: President’s vision aligns with modern demands – Ranaweera
author: Author not found
Content: State Minister for Small and Medium Enterprises Development Prasanna Ranaweera said President Ranil Wickremesinghe’s vision to foster entrepreneurship in the present generation aligns with the demands of the modern world. During a media briefing at the President’s Media Centre (PMC), the State Minister emphasised a historic collaboration with the Asian Development Bank (ADB). A fund of Rs 30 billion has been allocated under the small loan scheme for enterprise development, providing entrepreneurs with the initial capital required and a 2 per cent loan interest relief. Ranaweera further said, “Fostering the growth of entrepreneurs, constituting 2.8 per cent of our country’s total population, is a responsibility bestowed upon us. Between 2024 and 2028, our objectives include elevating the entrepreneur count to 10 per cent. Presently, initiatives are underway to cultivate micro, small and medium-scale entrepreneurs within this demographic. To achieve this, extensive collaborative efforts have been initiated with the institutions under the Ministry. Additionally, over 200,000 children enter the job market following the G.C.E. Ordinary Level Examination, facing limited opportunities. Our aim is to empower them to become entrepreneurs. We also aspire to uplift children who take to the streets with three-wheelers, vending by offering essential knowledge and training, providing them with an opportunity for a better future. For the first time in history, a groundbreaking initiative has been undertaken in collaboration with the Asian Development Bank, allocating Rs 30 billion under the small loan scheme for enterprise development. The focus is on providing essential initial capital under a 2 per cent loan interest concession. President Ranil Wickremesinghe’s vision is to transform the present generation into entrepreneurs, aligning them with the demands of the modern world. Moreover, the global market is prepared to allocate 789 billion for handicrafts in the fiscal year 2024-2025. Securing just 1 per cent of this market share for our country would be a significant accomplishment.”

title: Reduction in electricity tariff mandatory
author: Author not found
Content: In response to the Ceylon Electricity Board’s (CEB) proposal to raise electricity tariffs, Janaka Ratnayake, former Chairman of the Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka (PUCSL), emphasised the inaccuracy in forecasting this year’s expenditure at Rs 720 billion.  Ratnayake asserted that, based on the actual expenditure of Rs 575 billion, immediate reductions in electricity tariffs were warranted.  This statement was issued yesterday (3).Pointing out the discrepancy between the CEB’s projection of Rs 720 billion and the realised expenditure of Rs 575 billion, Ratnayake argued that the board has generated substantial profits, with consumers paying Rs 50 per unit of electricity as recommended by the CEB. Examining the CEB’s expenditure over the last 11 months, Ratnayake disclosed that it amounted to Rs 540 billion. With an additional Rs 38 billion anticipated for the current month, the total expenditure would slightly exceed Rs 575 billion. He lamented that had his estimate been heeded when the electricity tariff was increased, the public and the economy would have been spared the current ramifications.

title: 25,000 housing units at a cost of Rs 5M for Northern Fishers – Devananda
author: Author not found
Content: Fisheries Minister Douglas Devananda yesterday (3) said arrangements have been made to construct 25,000 housing units, targeting under-privileged families and those at grassroots level in the Northern Province. Devananda said the plan involved building housing units at a cost of Rs 5 million each, with the intention of supplying power through a solar panel system. The housing project incorporating solar power panels aligns with the concept introduced by President Ranil Wickremesinghe to address both the housing crisis and energy shortage simultaneously, according to Devananda. During the recent Jaffna District Development Committee Meeting, chaired by him, Devananda  emphasised the importance of this initiative. He highlighted that Cooperative Societies in the province had brought to his attention a shortage of sugar. Prompt action was taken to address the issue in consultation with Trade and Commerce Minister Nalin Fernando. Minister Fernando has agreed to dispatch 100 metric tons of sugar to the Northern Province. Plans are underway to distribute this consignment through 48 cooperative societies in the province, Devananda added.  By Naalir Jamaldeen

title: India yet to fulfil treaty obligations
author: Author not found
Content: Though half a century has lapsed since India signed the Indo-Sri Lankan agreements (Sirimavo-Shastri Pact of 1964 and Sirima-Gandhi Pact of 1974) to resolve the status of Indian Origin Tamils (IOT) in Sri Lanka, the Indian Government has still not fulfilled its treaty obligations, observed the Madurai Bench of Madras High Court on Thursday. “While India was obliged to repatriate and grant citizenship to not less than six lakh IOTs from Sri Lanka, as of date only 4,61,639 IOTs have been conferred with Indian citizenship,” said Justice GR Swaminathan. Pointing out that Article 51 of the Indian Constitution mandates that the State should endeavour to foster respect for treaty obligations in the dealings of organised people with one another, the judge opined that India will have to confer citizenship on not less than 1,37,000 IOTs to fulfil the above agreements. The judge made the observations while passing orders on a petition filed by one T Ganesan seeking Indian Citizenship. After 33 years of being called a ‘refugee’ in his own land, the 70-year-old repatriate from Sri Lanka finally gets a new lease of life, thanks to the judge, who directed the Indian government to recognise Ganesan’s status as an ‘Indian Citizen’ and ordered rehabilitation of him and his family. Speaking to TNIE, Ganesan’s advocate Romeo Roy Alfred said the order is an important milestone that sheds light on the Indian Origin Tamils who are living in the tag of refugees in their motherland. “There are 104 refugee camps in Tamil Nadu, with over 57,000 Sri Lankan. Besides them, 34,000 refugees live outside the camps. At least half of the refugees inside the camp and 80% of the refugees living outside the camps could be Indian Origin Tamils,” Alfred claims. Even if all these people were given Indian Citizenship, it would still be short of the figure which was agreed upon and left unfulfilled by the Indian Government in the 1964 and 1974 agreements, he added. He further stated that recently, a preliminary survey was conducted by the government in the refugee camps to identify IOTs and even as per the preliminary data, nearly 5,130 inmates were found to belong to IOT category. He urged the Central and State governments to conduct a full-fledged survey to identify IOTs and confer Indian Citizenship on them. Only then, people like Ganesan who got abandoned by the Indian government’s suspension of the repatriation attempts due to the Black July genocide and were forced to spend decades of their life in refugee camps in their own soil, would get justice, he added. He also expressed hope that the present order will strengthen the pathways for Sri Lankan Tamil refugees who are longing for decades to attain Indian Citizenship. Ganesan was born in 1954 to an Indian-origin Tamil family which was engaged in tea plantation work in Sri Lanka. He had applied for a passport in 1970 when he was 16 years old. However, the Attache/Assistant High Commission of India, Kandy issued a passport to him only on 22 August, 1982. Since the Indian government had temporarily stopped the repatriation mission in 1984, Ganesan and his family had to flee to India on their own efforts in 1990. However, the Indian government refused to acknowledge Ganesan’s status as ‘Indian Citizen’. Though they accepted that his passport was genuine, they stated that the photograph on the passport was of a far younger person (a photo submitted by Ganesan at the time of applying) and told him to bring conclusive evidence to prove that the document was issued to him. Due to this, Ganesan was unable to prove his citizenship and has been living in the refugee camp in Karur with his family, including grandchildren, for the past 33 years. Justice Swaminathan observed, “Issuance of passport is a sovereign act. When the genuineness of the passport is not in doubt, the exercise of matching the photograph found therein with the claimant has to be undertaken only by the authority concerned. This burden cannot be shifted to the applicant.” He directed the government to recognise Ganesan and his family members as Indian Citizens and provide them with the relief and rehabilitation measures announced by the government for repatriates like him. (The New Indian Express)

title: Youth killed in road mishap
author: Author not found
Content: A 22-year-old died on the spot in a head-on collision, involving a motorcycle and a sales van, at the Navatkadu area of Achchuveli, along the Jaffna-Point Pedro main road early yesterday (3). The Achchuveli Police said that the victim has been identified as Sivanesan Siyan, a resident of the Puttur in Jaffna. Two others who were critically injured in the accident were initially admitted to Base Hospital Point Pedro, and one of them, who was in critical condition, was transferred to Teaching Hospital, Jaffna, Police added. By Naalir Jamaldeen

title: Moratumulla murder suspect arrested
author: Author not found
Content: The suspect sought in connection with the assault and murder of a woman in Moratumulla last Wednesday (29 November) was arrested on Saturday (2 December), Police said. The individual is an 18-year-old male hailing from Pahala Indibedda in Moratuwa. Following interrogation, Police retrieved the crowbar used in the crime, a blood-stained shirt worn by the suspect and a smartphone. Moratumulla Police are conducting investigations.

title: Screen patients who received Immunoglobulin IV for AIDS, Hepatitis B
author: Author not found
Content: Those who received the contentious substandard Immunoglobulin IV should be screened for HIV AIDS and hepatitis B, former State Minister of Health Channa Jayasumana said in Parliament yesterday (30 November).  Jayasumana, who was participating in the Committee Stage debate on the Expenditure Head of the Health Ministry, urged the relevant authorities to take immediate steps to screen the patients who received the said medicine for AIDS and hepatitis B.  He emphasised that as the immunoglobulin medicine is a blood-based product, it could pose a significant health risk to those who had received it. Speaking further, he pointed out that there has been a concerning surge in the spread of AIDS in the country over the past few years, with reports of approximately 6,000 patients.  In 2022 alone, 600 individuals infected with AIDS were identified.  The former State Minister also highlighted the alarming statistics that one AIDS patient is reported for every 3,000 persons in Sri Lanka, emphasising the need for thorough screening and monitoring in response to the potential health risks associated with the substandard medicine. Sri Lanka’s National Sexually Transmitted Diseases (NSTD)/AIDS Control Programme recently said it has faced challenges in meeting UNAIDS and Global Development Goals targets due to the reluctance of potential vulnerable groups to access their services, driven by fears of discrimination and stigma. The programme Director Dr. Janaki Vidanapathirana emphasised that HIV testing is crucial in achieving the ambitious goal of ending AIDS by 2030, with UNAIDS recommending the 95-95-95 targets by 2025 for any country committed to this objective.  This entails ensuring that 95 per cent of people living with HIV are aware of their HIV status. Dr. Vidanapathirana stressed the need for creating an environment where individuals feel comfortable testing themselves without the fear of judgment. Additionally, the absence of Age-Appropriate Sexuality Education emerged as a significant factor in preventing the rising instances of HIV infections among teenagers and youth. Dr. Vidanapathirana noted a gradual increase in HIV infections among individuals aged 15 to 24 since 2018, with 12 per cent of the 607 new cases in this age group. Expressing concern, she highlighted that 66 of these cases were males. BY Methmalie Dissanayake

title: New Kelani Bridge to close in three phases from today
author: Author not found
Content: The New Kelani Bridge, also named as the ‘Golden Gate Kalyani’ bridge, is scheduled for closure, in three phases, starting today (1 December), the Road Development Authority (RDA) announced.  According to a statement from the Ministry of Transport and Highways, the completion of construction work on the New Kelani Bridge marks a crucial stage where all project-related responsibilities must be reviewed before the contracted company is released. In some instances, adjustments may be necessary and will be carried out by the contractor. While the bridge is currently deemed safe for use without any risks, the ministry expressed the intention to adhere to contractual stipulations by initiating a comprehensive review process. Consequently, the closure of the New Kelani Bridge will occur in three phases to facilitate essential modernisation activities.  The closure of the New Kelani Bridge will take place in three distinct phases, each characterized by specific timeframes. Phase 01 is scheduled from 9.00 p.m. today (1) to 6.00 a.m. on 4 December. Following this, Phase 02 will take place from 9.00 p.m. on 8 December to 6.00 a.m. on 11 December (Monday). Lastly, Phase 03 is set to take place from 9.00 p.m. on 15 December to 6.00 a.m. on 18 December.  During these designated periods, motorists are advised to seek alternative routes to accommodate the essential modernisation activities on the bridge.

title: Ports Ministry says Harin’s statement ‘NOT TRUE’
author: By Sulochana Ramiah Mohan
Content: The Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Aviation has categorically stated that there is no truth to the claims made by Minister of Tourism Harin Fernando, during the Mumbai tourism roadshow, that an Indian investor might take control of the three main airports in Sri Lanka, including the BIA. The Tourism Minister, speaking at the Outbound Travel Mart (OTM), India’s leading and only travel show focused on outbound travel, said, “I will break the news that Indian companies are taking our three airports which is going to be a phenomenal decision to really help us. The fuel tanks are taken by the Indian companies, the solar power projects are also taken by the Indians.” Further, the Minister of Tourism also told a Hindu Businessline journalist and the Hindustan Times, Pune News and many other Indian media outlets that were present at the roadshow that discussions are underway between the two sides, potentially involving management contracts. The newspaper quoted Minister Fernando as stating that the Adani Group is in negotiations with Sri Lankan authorities to manage three airports in the island nation, including the BIA. He mentioned plans to collaborate with the Adani Group for airport management, as reported by Businessline on the sidelines of the OTM show in Mumbai. Sources informed Ceylon Today that Minister Fernando has been requested to provide clarification on the matter, as the Sri Lankan Government has no plans to allocate shares to any foreign investors for the BIA or the Ratmalana International Airport. The only finalised agreement concerns the sale of the Mattala Airport to a Russo-Indian joint venture. According to the Aviation Ministry, the statement made by Minister Fernando during the Mumbai roadshow regarding the transfer of the three airports to an Indian investor was misleading information. The Government has clarified that there are no such plans in place for such a transfer. Additionally, the State-Owned Enterprise Restructuring Unit has stated that they have no knowledge of the developments regarding the airport proposals. Ceylon Today has previously reported that the Mattala Airport will be managed by Russia’s Airports of Regions Management Company (AR), in collaboration with an Indian firm, as a joint venture. Sources indicate that the Indian company involved in this venture is likely to be the Adani Group. Secretary of Sri Lanka’s Ministry of Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Aviation K.D.S. Ruwanchandra, however, told Ceylon Today that discussions have led to an agreement to transfer the operations of MRIA to a private joint venture and it is being finalised, but the Secretary did not disclose the names of the investors.

title: Former Health Secy gives statement to CID
author: Author not found
Content: Former Health Ministry Secretary Janaka Sri Chandragupta appeared before the Criminal Investigations Department (CID) yesterday (30) to give a statement in connection with the controversial Human Immunoglobulin (HIg) IV.   Speaking to the media, after providing his statement, Chandragupta said, at the time the Health Ministry had only aimed at importing medicinal drugs to overcome drug shortages. “As government officers we have only acted with great transparency in accordance to the rules and regulations.” He noted that fraudsters had made use of the situation. “A statement was given to the CID on measures that were taken within the law with regard to those fraudsters,” he added.  The former Health Ministry Secretary lamented that false reports had been given to the media the previous day regarding him by these fraudsters.  This shows who is behind this incident and who wants to tarnish the image of State officials, he added.    A travel ban has been imposed on Chandragupta, in connection with the HIgIV scam, while another five persons, including the Director of the Medical Supplies Division (MSD) and the owner of the Pharmaceutical Company, which allegedly supplied the HIgIV, have been remanded. By Dilanthi Jayamanne

title: MPs can’t be sued for statements made in House – Speaker
author: Author not found
Content: Speaker Mahinda Yapa Abeywardana, yesterday (30), asserted that MPs are immune from legal action based on statements made within the House. The Speaker’s statement came in response to a query from Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa, who raised the issue in Parliament. He highlighted that a case had been filed in Court against former Sports Minister Roshan Ranasinghe concerning a statement the latter made in Parliament. On Wednesday (29), a petition was submitted to the Court of Appeal, seeking legal action against former Sports Minister Roshan Ranasinghe for Contempt of Court. The petitioner, Attorney-at-Law Dimitri Shiraz Augustus Pietrangeli, claimed that a recent statement by the former Minister in Parliament was prejudicial to the President of the Appeals Court, impacting his career and character. The petitioner argued that, in accordance with parliamentary tradition, statements of such nature should not be made concerning judges of the country’s Top Court. The petitioning party further urged the Court to impose appropriate penalties against Ranasinghe for Contempt of Court and to compel him to explain why he should not be penalised. By Methmalie Dissanayake

title: Central Cultural Fund earns USD 3,000 per day
author: Author not found
Content: The Central Cultural Fund is now earning a sum of USD 3,000 per day from the foreign tourists, who climb Sigiriya to watch ‘Ira Udawa’ (Sun Rise), Prof. Gamini Ranasinghe, the Director General of the Fund said. He made this remark during the recent Sectoral Oversight Committee, on Religious Affairs and Co-Existence, held in Parliament.  Prof. Ranasinghe highlighted the remarkable financial progress, indicating a 614 per cent increase in the dollar generation of the Central Cultural Fund over the past two years. He mentioned that the fund now earns over USD 3,000 by allowing foreigners to experience the beauty of the sunrise in Sigiriya. The Director General also noted ongoing efforts to identify sectors around Sigiriya, that can further attract tourists, with KOICA committing to provide eight million USD to enhance these activities. Also, concerns were raised about some three-wheeler drivers, in tourist areas, charging exorbitant prices. Officials stressed the need to mandate the installation of meters for three-wheelers in these areas to address this issue. The committee, chaired by MP Upul Mahendra Rajapaksha, presented recommendations for amending the Central Cultural Fund Act, aiming to regulate the use of funds, specifically to prevent their utilisation for illegal activities.  Additionally, the committee was urged to facilitate the recruitment of employees for vacant positions in the Central Cultural Fund and to work towards confirming the status of the 286 unconfirmed employees, currently on duty, within the existing legal framework. Officials from the Public Trustee Department also presented their plans to increase revenue generation. They informed the Committee about ongoing efforts to utilise land and property effectively for income generation and initiated basic digitalisation measures to enhance the department’s efficiency. BY Methmalie Dissanayake

title: Protest staged at N’ Eliya Post Office
author: Author not found
Content: Another wave of protests broke out in Nuwara Eliya, yesterday (30 November), demanding to halt the Government’s attempts to sell historically significant post offices in Nuwara Eliya, Kandy, Galle, and Tidalavai in pursuit of immediate financial gain.  The protesters also called for the prompt filling of vacancies within the Postal Department.  The united trade unions of Nuwara Eliya Post Office protested in front of the Post Office citing several demands. The workers joined the protest during their lunch break. Workers assert that no new recruitment has occurred in the Department of Posts since 2016, pressing for the immediate appointment of new personnel to fill the existing vacancies. Their demands extend to raising the cost-of-living allowance from Rs 10,000 to Rs 20,000, citing the insufficiency of the former in the present economic climate. “Rs 10,000 simply doesn’t cut it considering the present cost of living; hence the call for Rs 20,000,” emphasised the demonstrators. (SRM)

title: Pastor Jerome undergoes eight-hour grilling
author: Author not found
Content: Pastor Jerome Fernando visited the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) yesterday (30 November) and was grilled for about eight-hours.  He has been requested to appear at the CID once more at 9.00 a.m. today (1) for the purpose of providing additional statements, Police Spokesperson SSP Nihal Thalduwa said.  The self-proclaimed ‘prophet’, embroiled in controversy over disputed comments on various religions made during a sermon, complied with Court directives to appear at the CID’s Cyber Crime Investigation Division within 48 hours of his return to Sri Lanka.  Pastor Fernando, who arrived from Singapore on a Qatar Airlines flight on Wednesday morning (29 November), left the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) through the Gold Route. The Court of Appeal, on 17 November , issued an Interim Order preventing the CID from arresting Pastor Fernando upon his return and mandated that he record a statement within 48 hours of arrival. In adherence to this ruling, he presented himself at the CID premises this morning.  The Court’s intervention followed a petition filed by Pastor Fernando seeking protection from potential arrest by the CID. The controversy erupted when a video of Pastor Fernando’s sermon circulated widely on social media, drawing attention to alleged derogatory remarks concerning Lord Buddha and other religious figures. President Ranil Wickremesinghe subsequently instructed the CID to launch an immediate investigation, expressing concerns about the potential for religious conflicts and harm to the country’s harmony. Despite a travel ban imposed by the Colombo Fort Magistrate’s Court on 16 May, Pastor Fernando had left for Singapore two days earlier.

title: Deshabandu Tennakoon assumes duties as Acting IGP
author: Author not found
Content: Newly appointed Acting Inspector General of Police (IGP) Deshabandu Tennakoon yesterday (30 November) assumed duties at the Police Headquarters, Colombo. A simple religious ceremony was organised to mark the occasion and many high-ranking Police officers were present.  Meanwhile, it is reported that President Ranil Wickremesinghe has informed the Constitutional Council (CC) about appointing Tennakoon to the post of Acting IGP. Accordingly, the CC will soon meet to take a decision on the appointment.  Deshabandu Tennakoon was the Senior Deputy Inspector General of Police (SDIG) overseeing the Western Province, and was appointed to the post of Acting IGP on Wednesday (29 November). This appointment became effective from 29 November 2023 and is valid for three months. Further decisions regarding this position will be deliberated and determined in the upcoming three months. BY Keerthi Mendis

title: Kahatagasdigiliya residents face public health nightmare
author: Author not found
Content: Residents of Kahatagasdigiliya in the Anuradhapura District have been severely inconvenienced due to the ad-hoc manner in which garbage and refuse matter is collected from within the town limits by the Kahatagasdigiliya PS Division and is being dumped in the nearby mountains.  Due to the haphazard way in which this garbage is being dumped within the town limits, the residents and villagers living in Medayakada and the nearby areas have faced health as well as environmental issues due to the stench of garbage. Residents of Rambawewa have brought this pressing issue to the notice of the authorities concerned, but they charged to date no concrete measures had been taken to address the matter.  These residents charged that the Kahatagasdigiliya PS and its Garbage Disposal and Management Unit are not operating to the satisfaction of the masses, resulting in the mounting garbage.  Further, they alleged that the Garbage Unit affiliated with the said PS is not being maintained according to the required standards, complicating matters. They said for several years, garbage and waste matter have been dumped in Boralukanda by the PS officers and due to this reason, villagers had abstained from using the Boralukanda River for daily needs as its water had become polluted.  These persons said due to the crass actions of the said PS, some 400 families in the area had faced untold hardship and they alleged that despite the matters being brought to the attention of the officials concerned, there was no improvement in their situation. They pointed out that the Garbage Unit attached to the PS has become a white elephant, with no tangible service being rendered by it towards the public.  They noted that garbage is also consumed by wild elephants, birds, monkeys and stray dogs and tends to get mixed with their well water, resulting in health hazards to both elders and young alike. They added that the consumption of garbage by these animals had posed a serious risk to their health and lamented that the matter has continued to worsen. Secretary of the PS concerned, P.R. Inoka Priyadarshani said, to date no official complaint had been lodged with them regarding any haphazard disposal of garbage to the mountaintop. However, she agreed that the garbage that is disposed of tends to be consumed by wild animals and that it could pose a threat to them.  She also rejected the charge that the garbage collected was being released in an ad-hoc manner. She said the shortage of staff at the Garbage Unit had somewhat hampered their work when it comes to the disposal of the garbage but stressed that every possible precaution was taken to prevent health hazards and lasting damage to the environment. She also assured that all shortcomings would be addressed by the PS within a week.  By G.C.K. Balasuriya

title: STD/AIDS Programme to re-initiate free condom dispensation
author: Author not found
Content: With Sri Lanka commemorating the World AIDS day today (1 December), the National STD/AIDS Control Programme (NSTD/AIDSCP) said it was negotiating the re-initiation of one of its old projects, which was the dispensing of free condoms, in areas that are highly populated, to prevent and control the spread of human immunodeficiency virus (HIV).  Acting Consultant NSTD/AIDSCP, Dr. Champika Gunawardena yesterday (30 November) said, the Programme was in the process of formulating a proposal for submission to the seventh Cycle of the Global Fund, to obtain finances for the continuity of the project, which had been in place prior to 2017 when the NSTD/AIDSCP had distributed Condom dispense boxes to STD Clinics, as they were the ones who were aware of the localities which were populated such a bus stands, train stations, cinemas etc.  He noted that the lack of funds, with the onset of the economic crisis, had affected the project, while currently there were only a minute number of condom dispensers that are operative. They are refilled once in away by the health service employee working with the STD Clinics   Fielding questions the NSTD/AIDS CP said, that Vending machines would levy a minor fee for the condom, but what the Programme had initiated provided it free of cost.  Acting Consultant Dr. Gunawardena said, earlier that the NSTD/AIDSCP had initiated programmes to create awareness and increase HIV/AIDS testing, to meet the goals set for 2030.  The Programme  commenced HIV blood testing at identified places in Colombo District from 26 October 2023 primarily identifying areas occupied by high-risk groups where those who want could undergo instant blood tests, where the result could be issued within 20 minutes.   By Dilanthi Jayamanne

title: 483M units of rooftop solar power added to National Grid
author: Author not found
Content: The Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) announced yesterday (30 November) that a noteworthy contribution of 483 million units of electricity was integrated into the national grid, from 1 January to 30 September 2023, through the rooftop solar power electrical installation initiative for consumers. CEB Media Spokesman Noel Priyantha, in a statement said, there is a widespread backing from customers nationwide for this distinctive national endeavour. Priyantha, expressing appreciation for the consumers’ transition to selling electricity to the national system, highlighted the shift towards a new technological experience, diverging from the conventional method of electricity usage.

title: Triple Victory for Ogilvy Group
author: Author not found
Content: The Ogilvy Group Sri Lanka made a mark at the much-anticipated Campaign Asia Agency of the Year 2023 Awards, clinching top honours in three primary categories in the Rest of South Asia region. The agencies received their accolades at the official awards ceremony held at the ITC Maratha Mumbai on 28 November.  Phoenix Ogilvy secured the Gold in the Rest of South Asia Creative Agency of the Year category while Ogilvy PR & Influence won the Silver in the Rest of South Asia PR Agency of the Year category.  Ogilvy Digital brought home Bronze in the Rest of South Asia Digital Agency of the Year category.  Organised by Campaign, one of the world’s leading business media brands, the Campaign Asia Agency of the Year Awards is in its 30th year of recognising outstanding business performance, inspiring leadership, management excellence and overall achievements in brand communications. The awarding process includes PwC as a Process Integrity Partner to ensure transparency. The Rest of South Asia categories are a true test of regional prowess, with agencies from Sri Lanka, Bangladesh, Bhutan and Nepal all competing for top honours.   This is Phoenix Ogilvy’s third consecutive win and Ogilvy Digital’s fourth consecutive year being recognised at Campaign Asia’s Agency of the Year Awards, highlighting their consistent business performance. Additionally, Ogilvy PR & Influence Sri Lanka stands out as the highest and only medal winner this year and the inaugural award winner in the Category.  Commenting on this collective win, Irvin Weerackody, Chairman of Ogilvy Group Sri Lanka said, “In a year fraught with macro-economic challenges, these wins underscore the tenacity demonstrated across the Ogilvy Group consisting of five companies. It is a testament to the patience and persistence to not only survive but to thrive amidst adversity, and these awards are a recognition of the outstanding work and commitment of our teams.” Meanwhile, at the Effie Awards Sri Lanka, held on the same day as the Campaign Asia Agency of the Year Awards in Mumbai, Phoenix Ogilvy won the Gold for their campaign for Lysol, two Bronze medals and a Finalist award for the work done for Baby Cheramy. Apart from the awards, the last six months saw Phoenix Ogilvy securing some of the most coveted accounts in the country, namely Sri Lanka Tourism, SriLankan Airlines and CEAT, competing with other agencies in the industry.  Marking 50 years in business, the Ogilvy Group Sri Lanka with a legacy of delivering impactful campaigns and strong business performance, has won a total of 12 medals at the Campaign Asia Agency of the Year Awards in the past six years.

Ceylon Today has previously reported that the Mattala Airport will be managed by Russia’s Airports of Regions Management Company (AR), in collaboration with an Indian firm, as a joint venture. Sources indicate that the Indian company involved in this venture is likely to be the Adani Group. Secretary of Sri Lanka’s Ministry of Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Aviation K.D.S. Ruwanchandra, however, told Ceylon Today that discussions have led to an agreement to transfer the operations of MRIA to a private joint venture and it is being finalised, but the Secretary did not disclose the names of the investors.

title: Pastor Jerome undergoes eight-hour grilling
author: Author not found
Content: Pastor Jerome Fernando visited the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) yesterday (30 November) and was grilled for about eight-hours.  He has been requested to appear at the CID once more at 9.00 a.m. today (1) for the purpose of providing additional statements, Police Spokesperson SSP Nihal Thalduwa said.  The self-proclaimed ‘prophet’, embroiled in controversy over disputed comments on various religions made during a sermon, complied with Court directives to appear at the CID’s Cyber Crime Investigation Division within 48 hours of his return to Sri Lanka.  Pastor Fernando, who arrived from Singapore on a Qatar Airlines flight on Wednesday morning (29 November), left the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) through the Gold Route. The Court of Appeal, on 17 November , issued an Interim Order preventing the CID from arresting Pastor Fernando upon his return and mandated that he record a statement within 48 hours of arrival. In adherence to this ruling, he presented himself at the CID premises this morning.  The Court’s intervention followed a petition filed by Pastor Fernando seeking protection from potential arrest by the CID. The controversy erupted when a video of Pastor Fernando’s sermon circulated widely on social media, drawing attention to alleged derogatory remarks concerning Lord Buddha and other religious figures. President Ranil Wickremesinghe subsequently instructed the CID to launch an immediate investigation, expressing concerns about the potential for religious conflicts and harm to the country’s harmony. Despite a travel ban imposed by the Colombo Fort Magistrate’s Court on 16 May, Pastor Fernando had left for Singapore two days earlier.

title: Pastor Jerome returns to SL
author: Author not found
Content: Pastor Jerome Fernando arrived in the country early last morning (29), via the BIA in Katunayake. Fernando returned to the island from Singapore at 1:32 a.m., with two others, on board a Qatar Airways flight and left through the Gold Route of the BIA, according to airport sources. He is slated to give a statement to the CID within 48 hours, as per an order issued by Court of Appeal. On 17 November, the Appellate Court instructed the CID, not to arrest Pastor Fernando, on his arrival in the country. The ruling also mentioned the self-proclaimed ‘prophet’, should provide a statement to the CID’s Cyber Crime Investigation Division, within 48 hours of his arrival in Colombo. This interim order was issued, in respect of the petition filed by Pastor Fernando, seeking to prevent the CID, from arresting him. The self-styled ‘prophet’, found himself in hot water, after a video of a sermon delivered by him went viral on social media, stirring much controversy in the country, due to allegations, that it included denigrating statements related to the Buddha and other religious figures. Subsequently, President Ranil Wickremesinghe, ordered the CID, to launch an immediate investigation into the matter, citing that such statements, could create religious conflicts and harm the country’s unity. However, Pastor Fernando fled to Singapore two days before the Colombo Fort Magistrate issued a travel ban on him, on 16 May. The Police had said Pastor Fernando could be arrested on his return to the island. On 26 May, the controversial Pastor had filed an FR petition, through his lawyers, seeking an order preventing his arrest. The IGP, the DIG in charge of the CID, the CID Director and the OIC of the Cyber Crime Unit of the CID, were named as respondents. In his petition, the Pastor had stated that the CID’s attempt to arrest him is unlawful, claiming that the Police had failed to present any piece of evidence to Court, to prove that his comments, threatened religious harmony in the country. By T.K.G. Kapila – Katunayake

title: CIABOC Resolved Only Two Out of 4,415 Complaints
author: Author not found
Content: Although the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) received 4,415 complaints from January 2022 to September 2023, only two of these complaints have been resolved, MP Dullas Alahapperuma revealed in Parliament yesterday (29). Alahapperuma submitted a question for Oral Answers on this issue, and he is scheduled to receive a response only in late January 2024.  Expressing concern about the significant delays in resolving complaints by the Bribery Commission, Alahapperuma sought clarification from Speaker Mahinda Yapa Abeywardana. He highlighted the passage of the new Anti-Corruption Act in Parliament this year as a positive step.  However, he noted a substantial issue regarding the failure to appoint new commissioners to the Bribery Commission. He emphasised the urgency of these appointments and questioned when they would take place. In response, the Speaker informed Parliament that the matter has been addressed at the Constitutional Council (CC), and steps will be taken to make the appointments soon. The delay of appointing new commissioners to the Bribery Commission was criticised by President Ranil Wickremesinghe in Parliament last week as well.  The President in a strong statement said, “We enacted the Anti-Corruption Act, and for the past three months, I have been awaiting the appointment of new Commissioners to the Bribery Commission. Despite our ongoing efforts to address corruption, the appointment of Commission members is facing delays due to concerns raised by a few individuals. We have consulted with the Attorney General, urging that even if there are minor issues, the names should be forwarded for appointments. I am prepared to confront any legal challenges and if our commitment to eliminating corruption is sincere, we could have proceeded with these appointments.” The Speaker, who responded to the President, said the delay was caused due to an error in the 22nd Amendment where the Constitutional Council was mistakenly referred to as the Constitutional Board. This error caused the delay in appointing members to the Bribery Commission and the matter will be resolved within two weeks. By Methmalie Dissanayake

title: AIDS walk to commence from Hyde Park on 1 Dec
author: Author not found
Content: Commemorating the World AIDS day, the National STD/AIDS Control Programme (STD/AIDSCP) will hold a walk, starting at 8:30 a.m. tomorrow (1) from Hyde Park, Acting Consultant STD /AIDS Control Programme  (STD/AIDSCP) Dr. Champika Gunawardena said.  Dr. Gunawardena said the walk will be held to coincide with World AIDS Day for which the Programme hoped to receive assistance from the Government and NGOs, the Tri forces, Police, Prison inmates, artists, youth and the community.  The walk will be through Punchi Borella, Maradana and several other areas within Colombo City and will end by about 12:30 p.m. at Hyde Park where there would be a few programmes for community entertainment and awareness.  He said the NSTD/AIDSCP had also initiated some programmes to create awareness and increase HIV/AIDS testing, to meet the goals set for 2030. HIV testing is the key to achieve the goal of ending AIDS by 2030, Dr. Gunawardena noted.  In a bid to achieve this NSTD/AIDSCP had commenced HIV blood testing at identified places in Colombo District from 26 October 2023. “We primarily have identified areas occupied by high-risk groups where those who want could undergo instant blood tests, where the test result could be issued within 20 minutes. However, a confirmation is done by referring those identified persons to the nearest STD clinic. The Acting Consultant noted that the community was also being made aware of the self-HIV testing possibility. A decorated double decker bus carries the message to the community in the Colombo city and other surrounding areas – mostly during the morning. He said this mobile awareness programme would end on 1 December 2023.  By Dilanthi Jayamanne

title: Indian HC arrives at Medawachchiya Railway Station
author: Author not found
Content: Indian High Commissioner to Sri Lanka Gopal Baglay arrived at Medawachchiya Railway Station yesterday morning (29).  He travelled from Colombo Fort to Medawachchiya on the Yal Devi train, disembarked at Medawachchiya Station and took a group photo. Subsequently, High Commissioner Baglay proceeded to Mannar and Jaffna for a two-day tour.   By Gayan – Medawachchiya

title: SDIG Tennakoon appointed Acting IGP
author: Author not found
Content: Deshabandu Tennakoon, the Senior Deputy Inspector General of Police (SDIG) overseeing the Western Province, was appointed to the post of Acting Inspector General of Police (IGP) yesterday (29). This appointment is effective as of 29 November 2023 and is valid for three months. Further decisions regarding this position will be deliberated and determined in the upcoming three months. It follows the conclusion of the tenure of the previous IGP of Sri Lanka, C.D. Wickramaratne. Although he was initially scheduled to retire earlier this year, the Government had granted him multiple service extensions. A discussion was held between the President, Public Security Minister Tiran Alles, President’s Chief of Staff and Adviser Sagala Ratnayake and President’s Secretary Saman Ekanayake with regard to the successor of C.D. Wickramaratne. During the discussion, it was agreed to appoint SDIG Tennakoon as the Acting IGP for three months.  Commencing his career in the Police service in 1998 as an apprentice Assistant Superintendent of Police, Tennakoon has since ascended through various ranks. His promotions include Superintendent of Police (SP) in 2006, Senior Superintendent of Police (SSP) in 2011, and Deputy Inspector General (DIG) of Police in 2015. In November 2019, Tennakoon assumed the role of Acting Senior Deputy Inspector General (SDIG) of Police, officially being promoted to SDIG on 1 January 2020. Serving as the SDIG in charge of the Western Province since 5 December 2019, he has contributed to law enforcement for over three years. Born in 1971 and educated at Nalanda College in Colombo, Tennakoon is an alumnus of Colombo University and Kelaniya University, earning his Bachelor’s and Master’s degrees, respectively. Throughout his 25 years of service in the Sri Lanka Police, Tennakoon has served in various regions of the country, gaining recognition for his efforts in combating crime and narcotics. Notably, he has implemented several programmes in the Western Province to address the challenges posed by the Covid-19 pandemic. Meanwhile, a proposal is to be presented at the next Cabinet meeting, stipulating the tenure of the IGP, according to sources. As such, the service period of the IGP will be capped at a maximum of three years. Tennakoon, after the appointment, emphasised that addressing national security concerns will be his foremost priority. He affirmed his commitment to advancing the Police service for the benefit of Sri Lankans. Highlighting his agenda, he stated, “The top priority on my list is national security. The second priority is eradicating the drug issue in the country, which has permeated into villages and affected schoolchildren.”  He also revealed that he has developed a programme to address this matter and plans to implement it shortly. In addition to combating the drug menace, he underscored his intention to take decisive measures against threats posed by underworld gangs and extortion attempts. He was speaking to reporters following his visit to the Gangaramaya Temple in Hunupitiya, Colombo.

title: Rambukpitiya principal remanded
author: Author not found
Content: Nawalapitiya Police arrested the Rambukpitiya Central College (CC) principal on Tuesday (28). He is alleged to have forced a group of students to eat the polythene lunch sheets in which they had brought their lunch.  He was produced before the Nawalapitiya Magistrate Nilantha Wimalaweera yesterday (29) and remanded until 4 December.  The suspect Janaka Jayawardhana is a resident of Bawwagama, Nawalapitiya. He had forced seven Grade 11 students to swallow the polythene lunch sheets and newspaper that they had wrapped their lunch in,as the school has been declared a polythene free- zone.  Two students who were subject to this punishment were admitted to the Nawalapitiya Hospital after reportedly falling ill. A complaint was lodged at the Nawalapitiya Police in this regard. When the news went viral, the principal was transferred to the Gampola Education Zone with immediate effect and an inquiry was launched.  However, when the Police went to arrest the suspect, following the complaint, he had fled the area. The suspect had then visited the Nawalapitiya Magistrate’s Court on Tuesday (28) and requested the magistrate to give an order to the Police not to arrest him. However, the magistrate refused. The Police arrested the suspect in the Court premises. BY Neeta Pathmakumari – Norwood

title: Lands valued at Rs 10.5B for investors next year
author: Author not found
Content: Minister of Urban Development and Housing Prasanna Ranatunga informed Parliament yesterday (29) that lands valued at Rs 10.5 billion will be made available to investors in the upcoming year.  During the Committee Stage debate on the Appropriation Bill 2024, the Minister disclosed that lands amounting to Rs 7.5 billion were released to investors this year.  Emphasising a shift towards long-term payment plans for land transactions, he said, “We have decided to release land on long-term payment plans.” The Minister also shared specific instances of land release, mentioning that Visumpaya Colombo and the President’s House in Jaffna have already been offered to investors. Visumpaya is slated for conversion into a luxury hotel, while the Jaffna President’s House will undergo transformation into an IT campus. In addition, Minister Ranatunga revealed a noteworthy financial achievement, stating that the Sri Lankan government generated USD 600,000 by selling houses in dollars. He highlighted that these properties were acquired by Sri Lankan expatriates residing abroad he affirmed the government’s intention to continue selling houses in dollars. BY Methmalie Dissanayake

title: USD 12B investments in RE projects to be discussed – Kanchana
author: Author not found
Content: Owing to the climate change-induced adverse weather patterns, Sri Lanka can no longer rely on hydroelectricity, Minister of Power and Energy Kanchana Wijesekara said yesterday (29).  As a result, with a growing global demand to move away from fossil fuels and coal, Sri Lanka should focus on renewable and sustainable energy production, he added.  The Minister was speaking at a press briefing held yesterday (29), at the Presidential Media Division.  He was speaking about the upcoming COP28 summit and Sri Lanka’s role. Also present at the media briefing were Minister of Environment Keheliya Rambukwella, Minister of Foreign Affairs Ali Sabry, Senior Adviser to the President on Climate Change Ruwan Wijewardene and the Chairman of the National Youth Services Council. The Minister said the Government has identified the need for up to USD 12 billion in investments in renewable energy generation projects to meet the targets by 2023. Bilateral and multilateral discussions among the 135+ Heads of State at the summit will play a crucial role in achieving this objective. He said Sri Lanka plans to unveil its first pavilion at COP28 to draw attention to the country’s challenges due to climate change. The Climate Justice Forum, hosted at the pavilion, will provide a platform for governments, intergovernmental organisations and stakeholders to discuss and prioritise environmental issues in the Asia Pacific Region. Wijesekara said the Sri Lankan political delegation attending the annual UN Conference of Parties (COP28), the climate change summit in Dubai this week, will comprise only six delegates, including President Ranil Wickremesinghe, three ministers and two MPs representing the Opposition. While over 80 Sri Lankan delegates are expected to attend the COP28 summit in Dubai, Minister Wijesekara said  based on observations from the COP27 summit in Sharm-El-Sheik last year, other countries prioritised the need for more youth representation. Consequently, Sri Lanka has decided to allocate more space for youth at this year’s summit. In collaboration with international non-governmental organisations (INGOs) and private entities, such as UNICEF and the British Council, youth representatives appointed by these organisations will attend COP28. The Minister emphasised that the respective organisations will fund the youth representatives, and the Government will not bear any costs. Meanwhile, Minister of Environment Keheliya Rambukwella added that plans for the Climate Change University proposed by President Wickremesinghe will be unveiled at the Sri Lanka Pavilion during the summit. Responding to a question raised by Ceylon Today, regarding Sri Lanka’s carbon footprint, which was also raised by MP Dr. Harini Amarasuriya in Parliament on Tuesday (28), Ruwan Wijewardene stated that logistical issues associated with alternatives like an online summit was not feasible. Minister Wijesekara further added that meeting over 135 Heads of State and foreign missions under one roof was a far better option than individualmeetings. BY Buwanaka S. Perera

title: Seven parties show interest in Mattala Airport – Ports Minister
author: Author not found
Content: Minister of Ports, Shipping and Civil Aviation Nimal Siripala de Silva yesterday (29) said in Parliament that at least seven parties have presented Expressions of Interest (EoIs) to transform the loss-making Mahinda Rajapaksa International Airport (MRIA) in Mattala into a profitable venture.  He also said there have been proposals to establish facilities for assembling and repairing aircraft at the Mattala Airport as well, Highlighting the financial aspect, the Minister said, “The losses of Mattala Airport have been reduced to Rs 1.5 billion, marking the lowest recorded loss since the airport commenced operations.” The Minister was responding to a question raised by MP Lalith Ellawala. BY Methmalie Dissanayake

title: Ports Ministry says Harin’s statement ‘NOT TRUE’
author: By Sulochana Ramiah Mohan
Content: The Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Aviation has categorically stated that there is no truth to the claims made by Minister of Tourism Harin Fernando, during the Mumbai tourism roadshow, that an Indian investor might take control of the three main airports in Sri Lanka, including the BIA. The Tourism Minister, speaking at the Outbound Travel Mart (OTM), India’s leading and only travel show focused on outbound travel, said, “I will break the news that Indian companies are taking our three airports which is going to be a phenomenal decision to really help us. The fuel tanks are taken by the Indian companies, the solar power projects are also taken by the Indians.” Further, the Minister of Tourism also told a Hindu Businessline journalist and the Hindustan Times, Pune News and many other Indian media outlets that were present at the roadshow that discussions are underway between the two sides, potentially involving management contracts. The newspaper quoted Minister Fernando as stating that the Adani Group is in negotiations with Sri Lankan authorities to manage three airports in the island nation, including the BIA. He mentioned plans to collaborate with the Adani Group for airport management, as reported by Businessline on the sidelines of the OTM show in Mumbai. Sources informed Ceylon Today that Minister Fernando has been requested to provide clarification on the matter, as the Sri Lankan Government has no plans to allocate shares to any foreign investors for the BIA or the Ratmalana International Airport. The only finalised agreement concerns the sale of the Mattala Airport to a Russo-Indian joint venture. According to the Aviation Ministry, the statement made by Minister Fernando during the Mumbai roadshow regarding the transfer of the three airports to an Indian investor was misleading information. The Government has clarified that there are no such plans in place for such a transfer. Additionally, the State-Owned Enterprise Restructuring Unit has stated that they have no knowledge of the developments regarding the airport proposals. Ceylon Today has previously reported that the Mattala Airport will be managed by Russia’s Airports of Regions Management Company (AR), in collaboration with an Indian firm, as a joint venture. Sources indicate that the Indian company involved in this venture is likely to be the Adani Group. Secretary of Sri Lanka’s Ministry of Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Aviation K.D.S. Ruwanchandra, however, told Ceylon Today that discussions have led to an agreement to transfer the operations of MRIA to a private joint venture and it is being finalised, but the Secretary did not disclose the names of the investors.
